title: Calories in Rum
meta_description: Discover calories in rum per standard serving, including full nutrition breakdown, alcohol content effects, and serving tweaks for mixers or proof variations.
assumptions: 80 proof (40% ABV), distilled rum, unflavored, no additives or mixers; standard serving basis.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by proof, brand, distillation process, and serving size. Always check labels for precise values.

quick_answer.text: 100 ml of 80-proof rum contains about 231 kcal, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 100 ml cola mixer (regular, not diet)

faqs.q: How many calories in a shot of rum?
faqs.a: A standard 1.5 oz (44 ml) shot of 80-proof rum has about 97 kcal.

faqs.q: Does rum have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Plain rum has 0 g carbs, fiber, and sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does rum proof affect calories?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more alcohol and calories; e.g., 100-proof rum has ~25% more kcal than 80-proof.

faqs.q: Are there calories in rum and coke?
faqs.a: Yes, the mixer adds caloriesâ€”100 ml rum + 100 ml cola totals ~273 kcal.

faqs.q: Is light rum lower in calories than dark rum?
faqs.a: Similar calorie content; differences are minimal and due to minor additives, not alcohol volume.
